alert.note: Alert for Greenbrier; Monroe; Summers (West Virginia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued February 17 at 7:21PM EST until February 18 at 2:45AM EST by NWS Blacksburg
info.description: ...Forecast flooding changed to Minor severity and increased in duration for the following rivers in West Virginia... Greenbrier River At Alderson affecting Monroe, Greenbrier and Summers Counties. .One to two inches of rain since Friday morning has brought the Greenbrier River at Alderson into minor flooding. For the Greenbrier River...including Alderson...Minor flooding is forecast. ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL JUST AFTER MIDNIGHT TONIGHT... * WHAT...Minor flooding is occurring and minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Greenbrier River At Alderson. * WHEN...Until just after midnight tonight. * IMPACTS...At 15.0 feet, Farm land along river bank near gage is flooded. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 6:45 PM EST Friday the stage was 14.5 feet and slowly rising. - Forecast...The river is expected to fall below flood stage just after midnight tonight and continue falling to 4.3 feet early Wednesday afternoon. - Flood stage is 14.0 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 14.5 feet on 02/02/1915. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov. The next statement will be issued late tonight.
